div.p: This tag belongs within WRITING PRODUCTION . It is designed to capture the mainly professional relationship between a writer and her publisher (or, in the case of dramatists, her producer). Encloses a sentence or more: a detailed account of a 50-year relationship or the briefest summary. Publisher includes literary agent, theatre producer, etc. There are no mandatory sub-elements for this element, but if possible tag the publisher's NAME or ORGNAME. An optional attribute, RELATIONSHIPTYPE, allows you to designate whether the relationship was personal or professional. If you need both attribute values, arrange your prose accordingly.
Here, you can explain that the publisher encouraged her for six years, or that he gave her bad advice on copyright.
div.codeblock: <PRELATIONSWITHPUBLISHER>During the publication of subsequent editions, DB had fierce disagreements with publishers including James Laughlin at <ORGNAME>New Directions.</ORGNAME></PRELATIONSWITHPUBLISHER>

<PRELATIONSWITHPUBLISHER>The second edition or issue, printed that same year by a publisher in Fleet Street, seems to indicate that EF was displeased with the publishers she had first chosen.</PRELATIONSWITHPUBLISHER>

div.p: This element involves a judgement call on the part of the researcher. If you think the aspects of the relationship which you wish to discuss are purely personal, then you might want to discuss the friendship in the BIOGRAPHY section. If the relationship was more professional, or a mixture of personal and professional, or if its personal character was significant for her writing, then the writing section is the place.
